column4: Hi! I'm trying to install the nvidia-glx drivers on Edgy with the generic kernel (AMD Athlon X2) and it wants to install linux-image-2.6.17-10-386 which I think I don't want?
Just means the driver needs an updated kernel
I think that was why after installing them once ubuntu only recognized one processor
ok, will try then, thanks for the help
im a n00b too, but im tryin to help :)
The X-Server didn't start after I installed nvidia-glx and booted into generic. Error message was something like The NVIDIA is kernel module version 1.0_8774 and the X module version is 1.0_8776
Hmmmm, the nvidia-module is of a higher version, odd
Wait, reinstall the nvidia-glx with the new kernel, that might be it
eh the other way round, nvidia is lower version
Then sorry, I got no idea.... I just know that's how I did it
np, might try to install nvidia-glx again
inside the new kernel tho. If you do it on the old kernel, it wont work, I think
hmm, that would mean the module on the generic kernel is older than the one on the 386 kernel
I know that when u install the driver, it installs a kernel module. If the module is installed on the wrong kernel.....
It worked! I just found out that there were newer linux-generic-restricted modules in the repo. After updating that it worked! Yikes!
